summary: This document is a compilation of daily lieutenant's logs from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York for August 12, 2019, covering three shifts (Morning, Day, and Evening Watch). It details routine prison operations, counts, equipment checks, and notes the presence of an inmate on psychological observation with a companion. The logs show the arrival of new commitments, including one brought in by the FBI in the evening.

events.title: Daily Prison Operations and Monitoring
events.description: Routine prison operations at MCC New York including multiple inmate counts, equipment checks, body alarm tests, and monitoring of an inmate on psychological observation with a companion.

events.title: FBI Delivers New Commitment
events.description: The Evening Watch log notes that the FBI arrived with one new inmate commitment at 11:05 PM.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: The logs document prison operations on August 12, 2019, the day after Jeffrey Epstein's death.
An inmate is noted as being on psychological observation with an inmate companion across all three shifts.
The FBI delivered a new inmate commitment to the facility at 11:05 PM during the Evening Watch.
The logs show routine counts, security checks, and note malfunctions in the public address system preventing PREA announcements.
The document is marked CONFIDENTIAL and is part of the SDNY case files related to Epstein.
